column4: Welcome, you are now talking to an AI doctor. As I am part of a scientific experiment, I would appreciate it if you could take the time to answer a super short questionnaire at the end of the interview. Tap Speak to ask your question and then tap Send to submit it to me.
below i have massive problems with ** **** i can't get really hard even when i'm trying can you give me some help on that please

It sounds like you are struggling to maintain an erection. This can be a sign of an underlying medical condition, such as diabetes, heart disease, or hormonal imbalances. I would recommend that you make an appointment with your primary care provider for a physical exam and possibly further testing to determine the cause. In the meantime, there are lifestyle changes that you can make to improve your erections, such as exercising regularly and reducing stress.
i think i'm also having acne at the same time and this may also be caused by hormonal imbalance can you give me any hints but i could do against this

Acne can be caused by hormonal imbalances, especially during puberty. To try to minimize the outbreaks, minimizing oil and dirt buildup on your skin, using a gentle exfoliation, and moisturizing regularly can help. Also, avoiding certain foods and drinking lots of water can also help. Additionally, your primary care provider may be able to prescribe medications to help better regulate your hormones.
i'm sorry doc but these are just tips that my grandma can even give me can you please be less superficial and just give me a correct

My apologies if my recommendations sounded superficial. I am providing you with general tips that may help with your acne and other symptoms. However if you would like more specific advice, it would be best to schedule an appointment with your primary care provider. They can conduct a physical exam, review your medical history, and order any tests which may help pinpoint your condition.
